meanings.definition: The act of employing someone or being employed in a subordinate or secondary position.
meanings.sent1: She juggled multiple subemployments to make ends meet.
meanings.sent2: His subemployments included part-time tutoring and weekend babysitting.
meanings.sent3: Balancing various subemployments felt like spinning plates.
meanings.sent4: In the orchestra of work, each subemployment played a different note.
meanings.sent5: The concept of subemployments became clearer as she took on more responsibilities.

meanings.definition: Additional or supplementary employments held by an individual.
meanings.sent1: He took on extra subemployments during the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: Her subemployments as a freelance writer allowed her to explore different topics.
meanings.sent3: Having multiple subemployments was like having a bouquet of jobs.
meanings.sent4: The subemployments were like puzzle pieces fitting together in his schedule.
meanings.sent5: The variety of subemployments added excitement to her daily routine.
